meanings.sent1: The little girl nutated her head in agreement.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the students nutated respectfully to the principal.
meanings.sent3: The penguin nutated its head comically at the fish swimming by.
meanings.sent4: The flowers nutated in the gentle breeze, as if bowing to the sun.
meanings.sent5: The old man nutated his head slowly, showing his approval.

meanings.sent1: The key nutated in the lock, trying to open the door.
meanings.sent2: The dancer nutated gracefully on the stage, captivating the audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat nutated its body playfully while chasing a toy.
meanings.sent4: The tornado nutated violently, causing destruction in its path.
meanings.sent5: The windmill nutated in the wind, generating electricity for the town.

meanings.definition: To move in a circular motion
meanings.sent1: The planets nutated around the sun in their orbits.
meanings.sent2: The figure skater nutated elegantly on the ice rink.
meanings.sent3: The toy train nutated around the track, delighting the children.
meanings.sent4: The compass needle nutated as the ship changed direction.
meanings.sent5: The carousel nutated slowly, carrying children on its colorful horses.
